data.title: 10-year-old child involved in shooting incident dies, Anderson County investigating
data.meta_description: Anderson County Sheriff's Office investigating child-involved shooting along Fox Creek Road.
data.text:
A 10-year-old child who was injured in a shooting and transported to Greenville Memorial Hospital on Tuesday afternoon has died, according to the Anderson County Sheriff's Office.

The child died Wednesday evening at Prisma Hospital. According to the Anderson County Coroner's office, the victim has been identified as Dahillian M. Patel, a 10-year-old male from Anderson.

Deputies at the Anderson County Sheriff's Office were informed about a shooting incident that occurred along Fox Creek Road on Tuesday, August 6. They also confirmed the child was shot and transported to Greenville Memorial, where they remained in critical condition.

Another child was also in the room at the time of the shooting, but authorities are investigating the circumstances that led to the gunfire.

The Anderson County Sheriff's Office urges anyone with information to come forward.

What we know about the case

Anderson County 911 received a call around 3 p.m. on Tuesday, August 6, for a person who was shot on Fox Creek Road in Anderson. Anderson County Sheriff’s Office, Anderson Police Department, MedShore EMS, and Anderson EMS responded to the scene.

The victim was treated and transported by LifeFlight to Prisma Health in Greenville, where he succumbed to his injuries on Wednesday, August 7, at 11:02 p.m.

Preliminary investigation shows that the victim was inside his residence when a firearm was discharged, striking the victim. The cause of death is a gunshot wound, and the manner of death is under investigation. An autopsy has been scheduled to assist in the investigation.

The Anderson County Office of the Coroner and the Anderson County Sheriff’s Office are investigating. As the investigation continues, detectives will work with the 10th Circuit Solicitor’s Office to determine whether criminal charges will be pursued.

This is a developing story.
